collections.name: awardscoaches

properties.name: award
properties.description: Name of the award received by the coach.

properties.name: lgid
properties.description: Identifier for the league in which the award was given.

collections.description: Records of awards given to hockey coaches.

collections.name: awardsmisc

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the person or entity receiving the award.

properties.name: id_
properties.description: Identifier for the player or coach associated with the award.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: Noted information about the award.

collections.description: Records of miscellaneous awards given to players, coaches, or other personnel.

collections.name: awardsplayers

properties.name: pos
properties.description: Player's position when receiving the award.

extra semantic info.note: A player with position 'W' (winger) can play as both LW (left winger) and RW (right winger).

collections.description: Records of awards given to hockey players.

collections.name: coaches

properties.name: year_
properties.description: The year of the season for this coaching record.

properties.name: tmid
properties.description: Identifier for the team the coach was with.

properties.name: stint
properties.description: The order of coaching stints for a coach with the same team in the same year.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: Additional notes about the coaching stint.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: Noted information about the coaching record.

properties.name: g
properties.description: Number of games coached in the regular season.

properties.name: w
properties.description: Number of wins in the regular season.

properties.name: l
properties.description: Number of losses in the regular season.

properties.name: t
properties.description: Number of ties in the regular season.

properties.name: postg
properties.description: Number of games coached in the post-season.

properties.name: postw
properties.description: Number of wins in the post-season.

properties.name: postl
properties.description: Number of losses in the post-season.

properties.name: postt
properties.description: Number of ties in the post-season.

collections.description: Season-by-season statistics for hockey coaches.

collections.name: combinedshutouts

properties.name: date_
properties.description: Day of the month of the game.

properties.name: tmid
properties.description: Identifier of the team that achieved the shutout.

properties.name: r_p
properties.description: Indicates if the game was in the regular season or postseason.

properties.name: idgoalie1
properties.description: Identifier of the first goalie contributing to the shutout.

properties.name: idgoalie2
properties.description: Identifier of the second goalie contributing to the shutout.

collections.description: Records of games where two or more goalies combined for a shutout.

extra semantic info.date_composition: The date of the game is composed of the 'year_', 'month_', and 'date_' fields.

collections.name: goalies

properties.name: year_
properties.description: Year of the season (e.g., 2005 for the 2005-06 season).

properties.name: stint
properties.description: Order of appearance for a player with multiple stints in the same season.

properties.name: gp
properties.description: Games played in the regular season.

properties.name: min_
properties.description: Minutes played in the regular season.

properties.name: t_ol
properties.description: Ties or overtime losses in the regular season.

properties.name: eng
properties.description: Empty net goals allowed in the regular season.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: An empty net goal occurs when a team scores against an opponent that has removed their goalie from the ice.
A shutout is credited to a goaltender who prevents the opposing team from scoring for the entire game.

properties.name: ga
properties.description: Goals against in the regular season.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: The number of goals recorded against the goalie while they are on the ice during regulation and overtime.

properties.name: sa
properties.description: Shots against in the regular season.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: The number of shots on goal recorded while the goalie is on the ice.
An empty net goal occurs when a team scores against an opponent that has removed their goalie from the ice.
A shutout is credited to a goaltender who prevents the opposing team from scoring for the entire game.
The number of goals recorded against the goalie while they are on the ice during regulation and overtime.
The number of shots on goal recorded while the goalie is on the ice.

collections.description: Season-by-season statistics for hockey goalies.

collections.name: goaliessc

properties.name: year_
properties.description: Year of the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: gp
properties.description: Games played in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: min_
properties.description: Minutes played in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: w
properties.description: Wins in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: l
properties.description: Losses in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: t
properties.description: Ties in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: sho
properties.description: Shutouts in the Stanley Cup final.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: A shutout is credited to a goaltender who prevents the opposing team from scoring for the entire game.

properties.name: ga
properties.description: Goals against in the Stanley Cup final.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: The number of goals recorded against the goalie while they are on the ice during regulation and overtime.

collections.description: Statistics for goalies in the Stanley Cup finals.

collections.name: goaliesshootout

properties.name: stint
properties.description: Order of appearance for a player with multiple stints in the same season.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: The number of shots on goal recorded while the goalie is on the ice.
The number of goals recorded against the goalie while they are on the ice during regulation and overtime.

collections.description: Statistics for goalies in shootouts.

collections.name: hof

properties.name: year_
properties.description: Year of induction into the Hall of Fame.

properties.name: hofid
properties.description: Unique identifier for the Hall of Fame induction record.

collections.description: Records of inductees into the Hockey Hall of Fame.

collections.name: master

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: If a person has both a playerID and a coachID, it indicates they became a coach after their playing career.

properties.name: hofid
properties.description: Identifier for the person's Hall of Fame record, if applicable.

properties.name: namenote
properties.description: Additional notes about the person's name.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the person in inches.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: Weight of the person in pounds.

properties.name: shootcatch
properties.description: Player's shooting hand (or catching hand for goalies).

extra semantic info.note: A null or empty value implies the player is skilled with both hands.

properties.name: ihdbid
properties.description: Identifier at the Internet Hockey Database.

extra semantic info.note: A player with position 'W' can play both LW and RW. Some players may have multiple positions listed (e.g., 'L/D').

collections.description: Master table with biographical information for all players, coaches, and other personnel.

extra semantic info.date_composition: The date of birth is composed of the 'birthyear', 'birthmon', and 'birthday' fields.

collections.name: scoring

properties.name: stint
properties.description: Order of appearance for a player with multiple stints in the same season.

extra semantic info.note: A player with position 'W' can play both LW and RW. Some players may have multiple positions listed (e.g., 'L/D').

properties.name: gp
properties.description: Games played in the regular season.

properties.name: g
properties.description: Goals scored in the regular season.

properties.name: pts
properties.description: Points (goals + assists) in the regular season.

properties.name: pim
properties.description: Penalty minutes in the regular season.

properties.name: plus
properties.description: Plus/minus rating in the regular season.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: Measures a player's on-ice goal differential. A positive number means their team scored more goals than they allowed while the player was on the ice.

properties.name: ppg
properties.description: Power play goals in the regular season.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: A goal scored by a team with a numerical advantage on the ice due to penalties against the opposing team.

properties.name: ppa
properties.description: Power play assists in the regular season.

properties.name: shg
properties.description: Shorthanded goals in the regular season.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: A goal scored by a team with a numerical disadvantage on the ice due to penalties.

properties.name: sha
properties.description: Shorthanded assists in the regular season.

properties.name: gwg
properties.description: Game-winning goals in the regular season.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: The goal that puts the winning team ahead of the losing team's final score.

properties.name: gtg
properties.description: Game-tying goals in the regular season.

properties.name: sog
properties.description: Shots on goal in the regular season.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: A shot that results in a goal or a save by the goaltender.

collections.description: Season-by-season scoring statistics for players.

collections.name: scoringsc

properties.name: year_
properties.description: Year of the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: gp
properties.description: Games played in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: g
properties.description: Goals scored in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: a
properties.description: Assists in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: pts
properties.description: Points in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: pim
properties.description: Penalty minutes in the Stanley Cup final.

collections.description: Scoring statistics for players in the Stanley Cup finals.

collections.name: scoringshootout

properties.name: stint
properties.description: Order of appearance for a player with multiple stints in the same season.

collections.description: Statistics for players in shootouts.

collections.name: scoringsup
collections.description: Supplemental scoring statistics for players.

collections.name: seriespost

properties.name: series
properties.description: Identifier for the series within a round.

properties.name: lgidwinner
properties.description: League identifier of the winning team.

properties.name: lgidloser
properties.description: League identifier of the losing team.

properties.name: w
properties.description: Wins for the winning team in the series.

properties.name: l
properties.description: Losses for the winning team in the series.

properties.name: goalswinner
properties.description: Total goals scored by the winning team in the series.

properties.name: goalsloser
properties.description: Total goals scored by the losing team in the series.

collections.description: Results of post-season playoff series.

collections.name: teamsplits
collections.description: Team statistics split by home/road and by month.

collections.name: teamvsteam
collections.description: Head-to-head records for teams against each opponent in a season.

collections.name: teams

properties.name: rank
properties.description: Final standing in the division or league.

properties.name: playoff
properties.description: How far the team advanced in the playoffs.

extra semantic info.commonsense evidence: A penalty assessed against the team rather than an individual player, often for actions by the coach or players on the bench.

properties.name: pkg
properties.description: Power play goals against (penalty kill goals).

collections.description: Season-by-season statistics and information for each team.

collections.name: teamshalf

properties.name: half
properties.description: Indicates if the stats are for the first (1) or second (2) half of the season.

properties.name: rank
properties.description: Final standing for that half of the season.

collections.description: Team statistics for seasons that were split into two halves.

collections.name: teamspost

properties.name: benchminor
properties.description: Bench minor penalties in minutes in the postseason.

properties.name: ppg
properties.description: Power play goals in the postseason.

properties.name: ppc
properties.description: Power play chances in the postseason.

properties.name: sha
properties.description: Shorthanded goals against in the postseason.

properties.name: pkg
properties.description: Power play goals against in the postseason.

properties.name: pkc
properties.description: Penalty kill chances in the postseason.

properties.name: shf
properties.description: Shorthanded goals for in the postseason.

collections.description: Overall team statistics for the postseason.

collections.name: teamssc

properties.name: year_
properties.description: Year of the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: g
properties.description: Games played in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: w
properties.description: Wins in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: l
properties.description: Losses in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: t
properties.description: Ties in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: gf
properties.description: Goals for in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: ga
properties.description: Goals against in the Stanley Cup final.

properties.name: pim
properties.description: Penalty minutes in the Stanley Cup final.

collections.description: Team statistics for the Stanley Cup finals.

collections.name: abbrev

properties.name: type_
properties.description: The type of entity the abbreviation represents (e.g., Conference, Division).

properties.name: fullname
properties.description: The full name corresponding to the code.

collections.description: A lookup table for abbreviations used throughout the database.
